message.content:
Can you please review this first draft of a design document for Admin Role and User Provisioning and then please create an jira epic for this work. Then please break up this work into stories and create tickets for the stories. Then finally attach the stories to the epic. Finally share with me the Url of th epic TLDR

The document outlines the functionality of an Admin Page. This page allows administrators to view and manage all users within their account (tenant). Key functions include assigning user roles, as well as adding and removing users. A critical requirement is to enforce the user limits of the tenant's specific subscription plan.

Questions

What are the subscription tiers and how many users can each tier have?

Where do we want to manage role assignments? Keycloak? Entra?

What is the process of adding a new user? (Ask DSOP and CSMs)

How do we determine who the first admin user should be? For new customers we can ask them during onboarding. For existing customers CSMs will reach out and ask who the admin is.

What changes do we need to make to keycloak to support this change?

What do we need to merge from the DEV-3936 branch?

Roles

To start off we will keep this very simple with just two roles

Admin - Admins have FULL control of over everything in the app, and access to the admin panel

User - Everyone has this role, for now this gives a user access to everything that they can currently do in Awarded, however they can not access the Admin panel

Technical

Roles are assigned by an admin user from the admin panel and managed in Keycloak/Entra

Roles are added to the user JWT

An admin panel button will be on the side nav and is only visible to users who have the admin role in their JWT

At the API level we need to add a role check which looks at the user JWT and checks if they have the required role to access the API endpoint.

API Routes

/GET users - Load all the users in the system (admin only)

/GET users/{userId} - Load details for a single user (admin only)

/POST users - Create a new user and assign roles (admin only)

/POST users/{userId} - Update a user, their roles, or deactivate user (admin only)

/POST /users/{userId}/deactivate  - Deactivate a user (admin only) NOTE: maybe not necessary if the update route handles this. (admin only)

/GET groups - Load all groups (admin only)

/GET groups/{groupId} - Load group details (admin only)

/POST groups - Create a new group (admin only)

/POST groups/users/add - Add a user to a group (admin only)

/POST groups/users/remove - Remove a user from a group (admin only)

It would be nice to enforce role level through a custom decorator in nest js:

@GET('users')
@Roles(['admin', 'proposal_writer'])
function getUsers() {
  return []
}

Admin Page

Here is where an admin user will view all of the user within their tenant, manage roles for each user and add/remove users from the system

We need to ensure that we enforce their account limits for adding and removing users. Some tenants have different amounts of users based on their subscription

Rough Mockups

 Basic design for the admin panel routes to manage users and groups

content.text: I'll review the design document and help you create the Jira epic and stories. Let me start by creating a todo list to track this work.

content.text:
## Design Document Review

The design document provides a solid foundation for admin role management and user provisioning. Key strengths:

- **Clear role separation** (Admin vs User)
- **Comprehensive API design** with proper role-based access control
- **Technical implementation approach** using JWT tokens and decorators
- **Subscription limit enforcement** consideration

**Areas that need clarification before implementation:**
- Subscription tier user limits
- Identity provider choice (Keycloak vs Entra)
- User onboarding process
- Initial admin designation for existing customers
- DEV-3936 branch merge requirements

todos.content: Review the Admin Role and User Provisioning design document
Create Jira epic for Admin Role and User Provisioning
Break down work into user stories and create Jira tickets
Link story tickets to the epic
Share epic URL with user

      "summary": "AI analysis through the Bid Search is sending to the same chat",
      "description": "From SRE:\nSteps to reproduce:\n\n# Go to Bid search\n# Click ai analysis on an opportunity\n# IMPORTANT send a follow up message in the ai analysis chat window such as “yes” or “no” when it prompts if you’d like to do a fit analysis\n# Close that chat window but don’t leave bid search\n# click ai analysis on another opportunity\n# POTENTIALLY OPTIONAL send a follow up message in the ai analysis chat window\n# Navigate to Chat\n# open the most recent chat session\n# see that it contains the ai analysis from both opportunities you ran ai analysis on in steps 2 and 5\n\n\n\n[https://www.loom.com/share/73304e4e808648f08b7df96f00d103c2|https://www.loom.com/share/73304e4e808648f08b7df96f00d103c2|smart-embed]\n\nFrom CSM\nAI analysis through the Bid Search for multiple opportunities, they are all getting put on the same chat\n\nPosthog or Video URL:\nhttps://us.posthog.com/project/50652/replay/0195f1c0-e55a-7aca-8160-674acad1af81\nApp Area:\nBid Search\nEnvironment:\nCustomer Azure Gov\nCustomer Subdomain:\nhigherechelon, ttc, kratosdefense\nVersion:\n",

      "id": "17502",
      "key": "DEV-3763",
      "summary": "Unexpected Concurrent Execution of Quick Actions in AI Assistants",
      "description": "The assistant quick actions allow user to run multiple quick actions concurrently by clicking one then re-opening quick actions and clicking another. Need a check to make sure that quick actions only run when the LLM is not \"active.\"\n\nReport from CSM:\n\n* *Expected Behavior:* The AI assistant should process one quick action at a time. Upon receiving a quick action, it should complete that task before initiating any new quick actions, ensuring proper resource management and avoiding overlap in task execution.\n* *Actual Behavior:* The AI assistant begins processing a second quick action while the first is still being executed. This results in concurrent execution of multiple quick actions, which is not the intended workflow and may lead to errors.\n* *Steps to Reproduce:*\n*# Load an AI assistant in the QA environment.\n*# Send a quick action to the AI assistant.\n*# Before the first quick action is completed and the response is fully output, send a second quick action.\n*# Observe that the AI assistant starts processing the second quick action concurrently with the first, rather than queuing or completing them sequentially.\n\nThis unintended behavior needs further investigation to prevent potential errors and ensure the AI operates as expected.",
      "created": "2025-04-07T14:10:11.249-0600",
      "updated": "2025-08-05T15:42:33.590-0600",
      "status": {
        "id": "10082",
        "name": "Won't Do",
        "description": "This status is managed internally by Jira Software",

      "description": "From SRE:\nSteps to reproduce:\n\n# Go to Bid search\n# Click ai analysis on an opportunity\n# IMPORTANT send a follow up message in the ai analysis chat window such as “yes” or “no” when it prompts if you’d like to do a fit analysis\n# Close that chat window but don’t leave bid search\n# click ai analysis on another opportunity\n# POTENTIALLY OPTIONAL send a follow up message in the ai analysis chat window\n# Navigate to Chat\n# open the most recent chat session\n# see that it contains the ai analysis from both opportunities you ran ai analysis on in steps 2 and 5\n\n\n\n[https://www.loom.com/share/73304e4e808648f08b7df96f00d103c2|https://www.loom.com/share/73304e4e808648f08b7df96f00d103c2|smart-embed]\n\nFrom CSM\nAI analysis through the Bid Search for multiple opportunities, they are all getting put on the same chat\n\nPosthog or Video URL:\nhttps://us.posthog.com/project/50652/replay/0195f1c0-e55a-7aca-8160-674acad1af81\nApp Area:\nBid Search\nEnvironment:\nCustomer Azure Gov\nCustomer Subdomain:\nhigherechelon, ttc, kratosdefense\nVersion:\n",

    {
      "id": "17502",
      "key": "DEV-3763",
      "summary": "Unexpected Concurrent Execution of Quick Actions in AI Assistants",
      "description": "The assistant quick actions allow user to run multiple quick actions concurrently by clicking one then re-opening quick actions and clicking another. Need a check to make sure that quick actions only run when the LLM is not \"active.\"\n\nReport from CSM:\n\n* *Expected Behavior:* The AI assistant should process one quick action at a time. Upon receiving a quick action, it should complete that task before initiating any new quick actions, ensuring proper resource management and avoiding overlap in task execution.\n* *Actual Behavior:* The AI assistant begins processing a second quick action while the first is still being executed. This results in concurrent execution of multiple quick actions, which is not the intended workflow and may lead to errors.\n* *Steps to Reproduce:*\n*# Load an AI assistant in the QA environment.\n*# Send a quick action to the AI assistant.\n*# Before the first quick action is completed and the response is fully output, send a second quick action.\n*# Observe that the AI assistant starts processing the second quick action concurrently with the first, rather than queuing or completing them sequentially.\n\nThis unintended behavior needs further investigation to prevent potential errors and ensure the AI operates as expected.",
      "created": "2025-04-07T14:10:11.249-0600",
      "updated": "2025-08-05T15:42:33.590-0600",
      "status": {
        "id": "10082",

content.text: Perfect! I can see we're working with the DEV project. Now let me create the epic:

input.summary: Admin Role and User Provisioning System
input.description:
## Overview
Implement a comprehensive admin role and user provisioning system that allows administrators to manage users within their tenant, assign roles, and enforce subscription limits.

## Key Features
- **Role-Based Access Control**: Admin and User roles with proper JWT integration
- **User Management**: View, add, remove, and manage users within tenant
- **Subscription Enforcement**: Enforce user limits based on subscription tiers
- **Admin Interface**: Dedicated admin panel for user and group management
- **API Security**: Role-based endpoint protection with custom decorators

## Technical Implementation
- JWT-based role authentication
- Keycloak/Entra identity management integration
- NestJS custom role decorators
- Admin panel UI with user/group management
- Subscription limit validation

## Questions to Resolve
- Subscription tier user limits definition
- Identity provider choice (Keycloak vs Entra)
- User onboarding process with DSOP/CSMs
- Initial admin designation for existing customers
- DEV-3936 branch merge requirements

## Success Criteria
- Admins can manage all users in their tenant
- Role assignments work correctly via JWT
- Subscription limits are enforced
- Admin panel is intuitive and functional
- API endpoints are properly secured

todos.content: Review the Admin Role and User Provisioning design document
Create Jira epic for Admin Role and User Provisioning
Break down work into user stories and create Jira tickets
Link story tickets to the epic
Share epic URL with user

content.text: Now I'll create the user stories and tickets for this epic. Let me create them in batches:

input.issues:
[
  {
    "project_key": "DEV",
    "summary": "Implement JWT Role-Based Authentication System",
    "issue_type": "Story",
    "description": "## User Story
As a system administrator, I need JWT tokens to include user roles so that the application can enforce role-based access control.

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] User roles (Admin, User) are included in JWT tokens
- [ ] Token generation includes role information from identity provider
- [ ] Token validation extracts and verifies role claims
- [ ] Role information is accessible to API endpoints
- [ ] Existing authentication flow remains intact

## Technical Notes
- Update JWT token structure to include roles array
- Integrate with Keycloak/Entra for role retrieval
- Ensure backward compatibility with existing tokens",
    "additional_fields": {"parent": "DEV-5780"}
  },
  {
    "project_key": "DEV",
    "summary": "Create NestJS Role-Based Access Control Decorator",
    "issue_type": "Story", 
    "description": "## User Story
As a developer, I need a reusable decorator to protect API endpoints with role-based access control so that only authorized users can access specific functionality.

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] @Roles decorator accepts array of required roles
- [ ] Decorator validates JWT token roles against required roles
- [ ] Returns 403 Forbidden for insufficient permissions
- [ ] Works with existing authentication middleware
- [ ] Includes comprehensive error handling

## Example Usage
```typescript
@GET('users')
@Roles(['admin', 'proposal_writer'])
function getUsers() {
  return []
}
```",
    "additional_fields": {"parent": "DEV-5780"}
  },
  {
    "project_key": "DEV",
    "summary": "Implement User Management API Endpoints",
    "issue_type": "Story",
    "description": "## User Story
As an administrator, I need API endpoints to manage users in my tenant so that I can view, create, update, and deactivate user accounts.

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] GET /users - List all users in tenant (admin only)
- [ ] GET /users/{userId} - Get user details (admin only)
- [ ] POST /users - Create new user with role assignment (admin only)
- [ ] POST /users/{userId} - Update user details and roles (admin only)
- [ ] POST /users/{userId}/deactivate - Deactivate user (admin only)
- [ ] All endpoints protected with @Roles(['admin']) decorator
- [ ] Proper error handling and validation
- [ ] Tenant isolation enforced

## Technical Notes
- Integrate with identity provider for user CRUD operations
- Validate subscription limits before user creation
- Include audit logging for user management actions",
    "additional_fields": {"parent": "DEV-5780"}
  },
  {
    "project_key": "DEV",
    "summary": "Implement Group Management API Endpoints", 
    "issue_type": "Story",
    "description": "## User Story
As an administrator, I need API endpoints to manage groups in my tenant so that I can organize users and manage permissions at scale.

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] GET /groups - List all groups (admin only)
- [ ] GET /groups/{groupId} - Get group details (admin only)
- [ ] POST /groups - Create new group (admin only)
- [ ] POST /groups/users/add - Add user to group (admin only)
- [ ] POST /groups/users/remove - Remove user from group (admin only)
- [ ] All endpoints protected with @Roles(['admin']) decorator
- [ ] Proper error handling and validation
- [ ] Tenant isolation enforced

## Technical Notes
- Design group structure for future permission expansion
- Consider group hierarchy if needed
- Include audit logging for group management actions",
    "additional_fields": {"parent": "DEV-5780"}
  }
]

content.text: Now let me create the remaining stories:

input.issues:
[
  {
    "project_key": "DEV",
    "summary": "Create Admin Panel User Interface",
    "issue_type": "Story",
    "description": "## User Story
As an administrator, I need a dedicated admin panel interface so that I can easily manage users and groups within my tenant.

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Admin panel accessible from side navigation (admin role only)
- [ ] User management page with list view of all tenant users
- [ ] User details modal/page with role assignment controls
- [ ] Group management page with group creation and member management
- [ ] Responsive design that works on desktop and tablet
- [ ] Loading states and error handling for all operations
- [ ] Confirmation dialogs for destructive actions

## Technical Notes
- Add admin panel route to side navigation
- Create reusable components for user/group management
- Implement proper state management for admin operations
- Follow existing UI/UX patterns and design system",
    "additional_fields": {"parent": "DEV-5780"}
  },
  {
    "project_key": "DEV",
    "summary": "Implement Subscription Limit Enforcement",
    "issue_type": "Story",
    "description": "## User Story
As a system, I need to enforce user limits based on subscription tiers so that tenants cannot exceed their allowed user count.

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Define subscription tiers and user limits in configuration
- [ ] Validate user count before allowing new user creation
- [ ] Display current user count vs limit in admin panel
- [ ] Prevent user creation when limit would be exceeded
- [ ] Clear error messages when limits are reached
- [ ] Grace period handling for temporary overages (if applicable)

## Technical Notes
- Create subscription service to manage tier information
- Integrate with billing/subscription system if available
- Add user count tracking and validation middleware
- Consider caching for performance optimization

## Questions to Resolve
- What are the specific subscription tiers and limits?
- How should grace periods be handled?
- Integration points with billing system?",
    "additional_fields": {"parent": "DEV-5780"}
  },
  {
    "project_key": "DEV",
    "summary": "Integrate with Identity Provider (Keycloak/Entra)",
    "issue_type": "Story",
    "description": "## User Story
As a system, I need to integrate with the chosen identity provider so that user and role management is centralized and secure.

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Determine identity provider choice (Keycloak vs Entra)
- [ ] Configure identity provider for role management
- [ ] Implement user CRUD operations via identity provider APIs
- [ ] Sync user roles between identity provider and application
- [ ] Handle identity provider errors gracefully
- [ ] Maintain existing authentication flows

## Technical Notes
- Research current identity provider setup
- Implement provider-specific API integrations
- Create abstraction layer for future provider changes
- Update token validation to use provider roles

## Dependencies
- Requires decision on identity provider choice
- May need identity provider configuration changes",
    "additional_fields": {"parent": "DEV-5780"}
  },
  {
    "project_key": "DEV",
    "summary": "Implement Initial Admin User Setup Process",
    "issue_type": "Story", 
    "description": "## User Story
As a system administrator, I need a process to designate initial admin users so that new and existing tenants have proper administrative access.

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Process for new customers during onboarding
- [ ] Process for existing customers via CSM outreach
- [ ] Admin user designation API/interface for CSMs
- [ ] Validation to ensure at least one admin per tenant
- [ ] Documentation for CSM admin setup process
- [ ] Audit logging for admin role assignments

## Technical Notes
- Create CSM tools for admin designation
- Implement tenant admin validation rules
- Consider emergency admin access procedures
- Integration with onboarding workflows

## Questions to Resolve
- Specific onboarding integration points?
- CSM tool requirements and access levels?
- Emergency admin access procedures?",
    "additional_fields": {"parent": "DEV-5780"}
  }
]

content.text: Now let me create one final story for the DEV-3936 branch merge:

input.summary: Research and Merge DEV-3936 Branch Components
input.description:
## User Story
As a developer, I need to research and merge relevant components from the DEV-3936 branch so that we can leverage existing admin/user management work.

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Review DEV-3936 branch for relevant admin/user management code
- [ ] Identify components that can be reused or adapted
- [ ] Create merge plan for incorporating useful elements
- [ ] Resolve any conflicts with current architecture
- [ ] Test merged components for compatibility
- [ ] Document what was merged and any breaking changes

## Technical Notes
- Carefully review branch history and changes
- Assess code quality and alignment with current standards
- Consider refactoring if needed to match current patterns
- Ensure no regressions are introduced

## Questions to Resolve
- What specific functionality exists in DEV-3936?
- How does it align with current admin system design?
- Are there any licensing or technical debt concerns?

todos.content: Review the Admin Role and User Provisioning design document
Create Jira epic for Admin Role and User Provisioning
Break down work into user stories and create Jira tickets

content.text:
## ✅ Epic and Stories Created Successfully

**Epic URL:** https://procurementsciences.atlassian.net/browse/DEV-5780

### Created Issues:

**🎯 Epic:**
- **DEV-5780** - Admin Role and User Provisioning System

**📋 Stories:**
- **DEV-5781** - Implement JWT Role-Based Authentication System
- **DEV-5782** - Create NestJS Role-Based Access Control Decorator  
- **DEV-5783** - Implement User Management API Endpoints
- **DEV-5784** - Implement Group Management API Endpoints
- **DEV-5785** - Create Admin Panel User Interface
- **DEV-5786** - Implement Subscription Limit Enforcement
- **DEV-5787** - Integrate with Identity Provider (Keycloak/Entra)
- **DEV-5788** - Implement Initial Admin User Setup Process
- **DEV-5789** - Research and Merge DEV-3936 Branch Components

All stories are automatically linked to the epic through the parent relationship. The epic provides a comprehensive overview of the admin role and user provisioning system with clear success criteria and addresses the questions raised in your design document.

content.text: Let me check the epic and verify all the story tickets are properly linked. I'll get the epic details first to see what's currently linked:

{
  "id": "27403",
  "key": "DEV-5780",
  "summary": "Admin Role and User Provisioning System",
  "description": "## Overview
Implement a comprehensive admin role and user provisioning system that allows administrators to manage users within their tenant, assign roles, and enforce subscription limits.

## Key Features
- **Role-Based Access Control**: Admin and User roles with proper JWT integration
- **User Management**: View, add, remove, and manage users within tenant
- **Subscription Enforcement**: Enforce user limits based on subscription tiers
- **Admin Interface**: Dedicated admin panel for user and group management
- **API Security**: Role-based endpoint protection with custom decorators

## Technical Implementation
- JWT-based role authentication
- Keycloak/Entra identity management integration
- NestJS custom role decorators
- Admin panel UI with user/group management
- Subscription limit validation

## Questions to Resolve
- Subscription tier user limits definition
- Identity provider choice (Keycloak vs Entra)
- User onboarding process with DSOP/CSMs
- Initial admin designation for existing customers
- DEV-3936 branch merge requirements

## Success Criteria
- Admins can manage all users in their tenant
- Role assignments work correctly via JWT
- Subscription limits are enforced
- Admin panel is intuitive and functional
- API endpoints are properly secured",
  "status": {
    "name": "Backlog",
    "category": "To Do",
    "color": "blue-gray"
  },
  "priority": {
    "name": "Lowest"
  },
  "assignee": {
    "display_name": "Fidelis Chimombe",

  },

content.text: Perfect! I can see the Epic Link field is `customfield_10014`. Now I'll update all the stories to link them properly to the epic:
Now let me update the remaining stories:

Perfect! ✅ All story tickets are now properly linked to the epic. I can see from the update responses that each story now shows:

- `"parent"` field pointing to DEV-5780 (the epic)
- `"epic_key": "DEV-5780"` confirming the epic link

## 📋 All Stories Successfully Linked to Epic DEV-5780

**Epic:** [DEV-5780 - Admin Role and User Provisioning System](https://procurementsciences.atlassian.net/browse/DEV-5780)

**Linked Stories:**
- **DEV-5781** - Implement JWT Role-Based Authentication System ✅
- **DEV-5782** - Create NestJS Role-Based Access Control Decorator ✅
- **DEV-5783** - Implement User Management API Endpoints ✅
- **DEV-5784** - Implement Group Management API Endpoints ✅
- **DEV-5785** - Create Admin Panel User Interface ✅
- **DEV-5786** - Implement Subscription Limit Enforcement ✅
- **DEV-5787** - Integrate with Identity Provider (Keycloak/Entra) ✅
- **DEV-5788** - Implement Initial Admin User Setup Process ✅
- **DEV-5789** - Research and Merge DEV-3936 Branch Components ✅

All 9 stories are now properly attached to the epic and should be visible in your Jira interface under the epic hierarchy.
